name: Transparent Hands USA
mission: Conduct free life-saving surgeries/medical treatments for poor people all across Pakistan through its transparent crowdfunding online healthcare platform.
theoryOfChange: By using a transparent crowdfunding model, the organization connects global donors directly to verified patient cases to fund life-saving medical interventions that the local public health system or personal finances cannot cover.
zakatClaimEvidence: Transparent Hands is registered in the US, UK, and Pakistan. Pay your Zakat, donation at www.tranparenthands.org/ramadan-donation-plan/. Additionally, Transparent Hands allows users from all over the world to donate Zakat, Sadaqah, and other forms of donations to needy patients in Pakistan while ensuring complete transparency. (Source: https://transparenthands.org/basket-listing)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Good donor alignment with manageable risk. Evidence quality is solid but still evolving in places.

components.evidence: Accepts zakat (+2); Muslim-focused organization (+2); Asnaf: fuqara (+5); Operates in Muslim-majority regions (+3); Humanitarian service (+2)
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

components.improvement_suggestion: Expand services to underserved populations or geographies with limited nonprofit coverage.

alignment.rationale: Alignment 36/50: HIGH Muslim donor fit, humanitarian cause area

components.evidence: Beneficiary count appears implausible; CPB excluded pending review
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Build reserves toward your board-approved target range (often 3-12 months), adjusted for revenue volatility and obligations.

all_citations.claim: The charity has a score of 89.75/100, a 72.0% program expense ratio, and 1.0 months of working capital.
Total revenue is $584,685 and fundraising efficiency is $0.23 per $1 raised.
The charity is Zakat-eligible and accepts donations for medical procedures.
The organization works with hospitals in Pakistan to provide free surgeries and medical procedures.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The charity earns a moderate overall score due to its high accountability ratings and direct humanitarian impact, though it is constrained by low working capital reserves.
areas_for_improvement: Limited liquidity with only 1.0 months of working capital available
program expense ratio of 72.0% is lower than some top-tier medical charities

dimension_explanations.alignment: There is high alignment for Muslim donors as the organization is ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE and addresses urgent humanitarian needs in Pakistan [3]. The mission focuses on critical healthcare gaps, supported by a transparent model that connects donors directly to patient cases [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The organization demonstrates a direct service impact by funding surgical and medical treatments for patients who otherwise lack access to healthcare [2][4]. While it maintains a solid Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100, its program expense ratio stands at 72.0%, and it maintains a lean 1.0 months of working capital [1].

baseline_narrative.headline: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC provides life-saving surgical and medical treatments to underprivileged patients in Pakistan through a transparent crowdfunding platform.
strengths: High Charity Navigator score of 89.75/100 indicating strong accountability and finance
Efficient fundraising operations with a cost of only $0.23 per $1 raised
Direct service model providing tangible medical outcomes for patients
baseline_narrative.summary: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC operates as a humanitarian organization that partners with numerous hospitals across Pakistan to provide free surgeries and medical procedures [1][2]. The organization is recognized as ZAKAT-ELIGIBLE, allowing donors to fulfill their religious obligations while supporting direct medical interventions for those in need [3].

rich_narrative.headline: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC provides life-saving surgical and medical treatments to underprivileged patients in Pakistan through a transparent crowdfunding platform.

ideal_donor_profile.best_for_summary: Best for donors who want to fund specific, life-saving surgeries for individual patients in Pakistan through a transparent, zakat-eligible platform.
donor_motivations: Want to see the direct medical outcome of their donation
Prefer a crowdfunding model where they can choose specific cases
Value high transparency ratings and low fundraising costs
Seeking to fulfill zakat through healthcare interventions
giving_considerations: The organization is smaller than many international peers
Financial reserves are lean, suggesting a high need for immediate funding
Focus is exclusively on Pakistan-based medical care
ideal_donor_profile.not_ideal_for: Donors seeking large-scale systemic health policy advocacy or those who prefer organizations with massive financial endowments.

impact_evidence.evidence_grade_explanation: Grade C reflects verified direct service delivery and outcome tracking, though cost-per-beneficiary data remains inconsistent.
impact_evidence.theory_of_change_summary: By funding individual surgeries through a transparent platform, the charity removes financial barriers to essential healthcare, preventing long-term disability or death.
impact_evidence.why_evidence_matters: Evidence ensures that surgical interventions are reaching the most deserving patients and resulting in successful health outcomes.

long_term_outlook.room_for_funding_explanation: With a <cite id="18">3-year revenue CAGR of -11.9%</cite> and <cite id="10">minimal reserves</cite>, the organization has significant capacity to absorb new funding.

peer_comparison.differentiator: Distinguished by its <cite id="1">crowdfunding model</cite> for individual surgeries, though its <cite id="11">72.0% program ratio</cite> is lower than the <cite id="12">88.2% peer median</cite>.

strengths.detail: The charity holds an <cite id="5">89.75/100 rating from Charity Navigator</cite>, driven by perfect scores of <cite id="8">100 in Culture and Leadership</cite> beacons.
The organization demonstrates high fiscal discipline with a <cite id="6">fundraising efficiency of $0.23 per $1 raised</cite>, ensuring more funds are available for patient care.
Transparent Hands utilizes a <cite id="1">direct service model</cite> that provides tangible medical outcomes for patients who otherwise lack access to surgical care.

strengths_deep_dive: Transparent Hands excels in organizational transparency and governance culture. It has achieved the highest possible transparency recognition with a <cite id="4">Platinum Seal from Candid</cite>, indicating a commitment to sharing comprehensive data on its goals and strategies. Furthermore, its <cite id="8">Accountability & Finance score of 89</cite> from Charity Navigator highlights a robust framework for ethical operations and financial reporting. The organization's model is highly focused, targeting <cite id="9">specific medical procedures in Pakistan</cite> to ensure that donor funds translate into immediate, life-altering health interventions.
rich_narrative.summary: Transparent Hands Foundation (US) INC is a humanitarian organization dedicated to providing life-saving medical care to underprivileged individuals in Pakistan. The organization operates a unique crowdfunding platform that connects donors directly with patients requiring <cite id="1">free surgeries and medical procedures</cite>. By partnering with a network of hospitals, the charity facilitates a wide range of interventions, including <cite id="2">cochlear implants and preventive healthcare sessions</cite>. In the 2023 fiscal year, the organization reported <cite id="3">total revenue of $584,685</cite>, primarily driven by public contributions. Transparent Hands maintains a strong commitment to transparency, earning a <cite id="4">Platinum Seal of Transparency from Candid</cite> and an <cite id="5">overall score of 89.89.75/100 from Charity Navigator</cite>. This rating reflects a high level of accountability, particularly in its fundraising operations, where it spends only <cite id="6">$0.23 to raise every $1</cite>. The organization is <cite id="7">verified as zakat-eligible</cite>, serving the asnaf categories of the poor (fuqara) and needy (masakin) through direct medical service delivery.
